info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:51PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN RHEA AND NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Soddy-Daisy, or 12 miles southwest of Dayton, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Soddy-Daisy, Graysville, Sale Creek, Flat Top Mountain, Mowbray Mountain, Shady Grove, and North Chickamauga Creek Gorge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
